solution_line_template: The {truffle_dozens} dozen truffles were sold in individual units so a dozen is equal to {dozen} so {truffle_dozens}*{dozen}=<<{truffle_dozens}*{dozen}={truffle_count}>>{truffle_count}
{truffle_count} chocolate truffles, at ${truffle_price_each} each sold for {truffle_count}*{truffle_price_each} = $<<{truffle_count}*{truffle_price_each}={truffle_total}>>{truffle_total}
The {pretzel_dozens} dozen chocolate pretzels sold in individual units so a dozen is equal to {dozen} so {pretzel_dozens}*{dozen} = <<{pretzel_dozens}*{dozen}={pretzel_count}>>{pretzel_count}
{pretzel_count} chocolate pretzels sold for ${pretzel_price_each} each sold for {pretzel_count}*{pretzel_price_each} = $<<{pretzel_count}*{pretzel_price_each}={pretzel_total}>>{pretzel_total}
All total, the store made {fudge_total}+{truffle_total}+{pretzel_total} = $<<{fudge_total}+{truffle_total}+{pretzel_total}={total_sales}>>{total_sales} from candy sales
